CatDescriptText: Mrs. Mamie Conner, 920 Cresswell Street, was part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, June 28, 1958, pg. 3 with question: "What do you think is wrong with the Pittsburgh Pirates? Do you think that they are using their best ball players at all times?" answer reads: "Yes, I do.  A policeman is an officer of the law and it is his duty, regardless of whether the person is a big shot or not.  He has that duty to the citizens who pay the taxes."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Mamie Conner wearing dress with horizontal stripes, flecking, and light colored dots, holding handbag and umbrella, standing in front of light colored flecked stone wall with checkerboard patterned trim
